statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ 3 \\ -4 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 2 \\ -5 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 8 \\ -6 \\ 8 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -20 \\ 8 \\ -6 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] are or are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^4

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ 3 \\ -4 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 2 \\ -5 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 8 \\ -6 \\ 8 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -20 \\ 8 \\ -6 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^4.
